description: Semi Co-op / Co-op / Solo (Legends of the Alliance)First game of this genre I bought when I got into the hobby. Coming from an RPG world, It was easy to get into. I had a great time playing as the overlord / empire (being a GM, this was also an easy transition). I was ecstatic when Legends of the Alliance finally came out. Thanks FF, you made my year!Components are top notch, game play is fast and easy (again, coming from an RPG world), and setting is great.

title: This is a ...
description: This is a test.

title: Very hot i...
description: Very hot in our house at the moment. We enjoy the skirmish and campaign versions. It is good how we can setup for just a mission/skirmish battle. It’s only an hour or so, yet it is still part of something bigger.....More of a hit with us boys (the Star Wars fans). Cath tolerates but does not find it as exciting as many of our other games. It a video game in a box for the boys. Different skills, levelling up, expansions, loot and new things to buy as the campaign progresses.The expansions are good, they do add to the game. They’re good stocking fillers, they add new missions, new maps and more command cards for the skirmish. I think will reinvigorate this game as we progress through the missions. The game is fine with just the core set, but what Star Wars fan would stop there anyway?!?

title: Still lear...
description: Still learning the game, but it does look awesome

title: SOLD, Conn...
description: SOLD, ConnCon 2019

title: Great game...
description: Great game.  Needs to be played with more than 2 people.

title: Campaign m...
description: Campaign mode is good but may be too much for just 2 people. Will need to try skirmish instead

title: fantastic ...
description: fantastic game!! first dungeon crawl system I played and I I love it.  definitely feel that the minis need to be painted in order to be immersed in the theme.  but I love the system.  I think the battle system is balanced and is great for dice mitigation.  I love that the rebels have these crazy abilities, but still have a tough time with the empire.  I LOVE DMing for the game, playing as the empire and deciding the course of the game and when to do what is an awesome roll.  Fantastic game I don't see my love for this game stopping, and duh it's Star Wars!

title: This is a ...
description: This is a LOT of game. It's good, but only invest if you have a lot of time. Not one to just pull out and play.

title: Only have ...
description:
Only have used the app to play it.

Have The Broken Token organizer for it and sleeved cards.  
https://www.thebrokentoken.com/imperial-organizer

Keep all base game tiles in this box, most of the tokens, the guides, the hero Rebel figures, the hero Imperial figures, and cards needed for the app.

title: Fun game! ...
description:
Fun game! For the campaign mode, it would be a toss-up for me whether I would pick this or Descent.

The skirmish mode however is excellent! Games are quick and exciting. Playing with iconic Star Wars characters is icing on the cake.

Expansions Owned: Everything through Bespin and I'm out! Edit: there's an app? I'm back in! Edit: wait, no app? In a holding pattern for now.

title: I still ha...
description:
I still haven't tried the campaign, because honestly playing the Empire does not look terribly fun. I'm open to being proven wrong, though.
The skirmish was unexpectedly fun. As of a billion expansions in, there's a decent amount of variety--and though the activation system is the same old nonsense, there's still some room for cleverness.

title: I didn't h...
description: I didn't hate this game. I was just expecting too much out of it. I probably would have loved it if I didn't already play tabletop RPG's. Not the game for me.

title: If you wan...
description: If you want a fun romp through a dungeon, filled with dice and story, this is a game for you. This isn't even a genre I typically like and I can still get behind this game. Plus it's Star Wars.

title: So much be...
description:
So much better than Descent. Better theme, improved rules, better balance, and better paced with Imperial and Rebel players going on alternate turns. 

Update: This is just not a game I really ever want to play. While I definitely see the appeal of the game, I am finding that I am not a fan of these random and combative games.

title: Takes the ...
description: Takes the gameplay from another title, improves on it, and adds a far better theme.

title: 8 on initi...
description: 8 on initial impressions. Played a few skirmishes. Beginning campaign with friends in next couple of weeks.

title: Easily the...
description: Easily the smoothest playing and most intense version of Descent. Star Wars theme actually adds to the experience over the generic FFG fantasy world that just feels kinda bland.

title: A dungeon ...
description:
A dungeon crawl in the Star Wars universe with an unfolding campaign.  Win!

INCLUDED:
Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Chewbacca Ally Pack
Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Han Solo Ally Pack

title: Great game with flexible play styles
description: Dripping with delicious Star Wars theme this game is absolutely amazing especially when played co-op with the app.

title: Fun dungeo...
description: Fun dungeon crawler, assuming the person running the Empire is not out for blood.

title: Convoluted...
description: Convoluted to learn, needlessly complex, unintuitive. Incredibly long setup. Fun when I got to the meat of it, and better than most "Ameritrash" titles. The genre just isn't my cup of tea. I could see this game rising though as efficiency in setup and understanding go up.

title: Most figur...
description: Most figures painted. Includes the base box organizer/insert. All cards sleeved.

title: Brilliant ...
description:
Brilliant dungeon crawl with the world's best theme.

The tactical game is fun too, however, I don't like the booster situation as I don't want to invest hundreds in keeping up, so I'll stick to the 4v1 player campaign which is quite enjoyable.  Some missions are very very hard, but the balance between the Rebels and Empire player seems decent (GM doesn't have to play with kid gloves).

title: I feel the...
description: I feel the same way as i did about Descent 2.0, it's not very balanced, could be fun with a GM that isn't trying to completely destroy you but not fun at all with one who is playing cutthroat. Just a frustrating experience and not much fun overall.

title: Was iffy o...
description: Was iffy on it my first play, but the ending was pretty exciting my last play, came down to the last move. Very fun
